articles.headline: Bernie Sanders, Eyeing Convention, Willing to Harm Hillary Clinton in the Homestretch
articles.snippet: Determined to transform the party, the senator is aiming to amass enough leverage to press his agenda at the convention — or even wrest the nomination.
articles.abstract: Determined to transform the party, the senator is aiming to amass enough leverage to press his agenda at the convention — or even wrest the nomination.
articles.lead_paragraph: Defiant and determined to transform the Democratic Party, Senator Bernie Sanders is opening a two-month phase of his presidential campaign aimed at inflicting a heavy blow on Hillary Clinton in California and amassing enough leverage to advance his agenda at the convention in July — or even wrest the nomination from her.
articles.byline: By Patrick Healy, Yamiche Alcindor and Jeremy W. Peters

articles.headline: Fed Is Seriously Considering Raising Interest Rates in June, Meeting Minutes Say
articles.snippet: The central bank sent an unusually frank message to Wall Street, delivered in the official account of the Fed’s April meeting.
articles.abstract: The central bank sent an unusually frank message to Wall Street, delivered in the official account of the Fed’s April meeting.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Reserve sent a sharp, simple message to financial markets on Wednesday: Pay attention. The Fed is thinking seriously about raising its benchmark interest rate at its next meeting, in June.

articles.headline: Online School Enriches Affiliated Companies if Not Its Students
articles.snippet: More students drop out of the Electronic Classroom of Tomorrow or fail to finish high school within four years than at any other school in the country, while companies tied to its founder have been paid millions.
articles.abstract: More students drop out of the Electronic Classroom of Tomorrow or fail to finish high school within four years than at any other school in the country, while companies tied to its founder have been paid millions.
articles.lead_paragraph: COLUMBUS, Ohio — The Electronic Classroom of Tomorrow, an online charter school based here, graduated 2,371 students last spring. At the commencement ceremony, a student speaker triumphantly told her classmates that the group was “the single-largest graduating high school class in the nation.”

articles.headline: Sandy Weill’s Wine Country Retirement, With Notes of Rue and Chagrin
articles.snippet: Mr. Weill, Brooklyn native, and his wife have decamped for Sonoma, Calif., after a career of soaring highs and vexing blows on Wall Street.
articles.abstract: Mr. Weill, Brooklyn native, and his wife have decamped for Sonoma, Calif., after a career of soaring highs and vexing blows on Wall Street.
articles.lead_paragraph: SONOMA, Calif. — Sanford I. Weill, who built Citigroup into a too-big-to-fail colossus and dominated the New York charity and social circuit more than a decade ago, lately can be found relaxed in jeans attending local wine country social events or riding his John Deere farm utility vehicle across his property to visit the neighbors.

articles.headline: Actions by Congress on Opioids Haven’t Included Limiting Them
articles.snippet: The House and the Senate have whipsawed between ensuring access to narcotic painkillers and addressing the addiction epidemic linked to those drugs.
articles.abstract: The House and the Senate have whipsawed between ensuring access to narcotic painkillers and addressing the addiction epidemic linked to those drugs.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Ed White has had a devilish time getting his painkiller prescription filled for intense back pain since a federal crackdown on opioid sales battened down the pharmacy shelves at the Walgreens near his home in Port Richey, Fla.
articles.byline: By Gardiner Harris and Emmarie Huetteman

articles.headline: Benghazi Panel, Plodding Along, May Conclude Near Conventions or Election
articles.snippet: Even some Republicans now say the committee’s pace risks feeding its reputation as an exercise meant to harm Hillary Clinton’s presidential campaign.
articles.abstract: Even some Republicans now say the committee’s pace risks feeding its reputation as an exercise meant to harm Hillary Clinton’s presidential campaign.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Gen. Carter F. Ham, who led the United States Africa Command on the night of the attack on the American diplomatic compound in Benghazi, Libya, has been interviewed at least nine times by investigators scrutinizing the events in 2012 that led to the deaths of Ambassador J. Christopher Stevens and three other Americans.

articles.headline: For Facebook and Conservatives, a Collegial Meeting in Silicon Valley
articles.snippet: The tête-à-tête at Facebook headquarters was an attempt to mend fences with conservatives, and most said it was a step in the right direction.
articles.abstract: The tête-à-tête at Facebook headquarters was an attempt to mend fences with conservatives, and most said it was a step in the right direction.
articles.lead_paragraph: MENLO PARK, Calif. — Cordiality reigned and pleasantries were exchanged. There was talk of virtual reality, a tour of Frank Gehry-designed buildings — and only a hint of disagreement.
articles.byline: By Mike Isaac and Nick Corasaniti

articles.headline: EgyptAir Flight Believed to Have Crashed at Sea; Egypt Cites Possible Terrorism
articles.snippet: Flight 804, carrying 66 people en route to Cairo from Paris, disappeared shortly before it was due to land. The reason was unclear, but the developments touched off fears about terrorism.
articles.abstract: Flight 804, carrying 66 people en route to Cairo from Paris, disappeared shortly before it was due to land. The reason was unclear, but the developments touched off fears about terrorism.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAIRO — The EgyptAir red-eye from Paris to Cairo, an Airbus A320 jetliner less than half full, had just entered Egyptian airspace early Thursday on the final part of its journey.
articles.byline: By Declan Walsh and Kareem Fahim

articles.headline: What Would It Take for Donald Trump to Deport 11 Million and Build a Wall?
articles.snippet: Mr. Trump’s proposal, which calls for deporting millions and building a wall along the southern border, is financially, scientifically and legally problematic, experts say.
articles.abstract: Mr. Trump’s proposal, which calls for deporting millions and building a wall along the southern border, is financially, scientifically and legally problematic, experts say.
articles.lead_paragraph: Big promises are to be expected from presidential candidates, but reality often intrudes. The elder George Bush broke the “no new taxes” pledge that helped lead to his election. And Barack Obama’s administration has yet to live up to his prediction that his nomination would go down in history as the moment “when the rise of the oceans began to slow and our planet began to heal.”
articles.byline: By Julia Preston, Alan Rappeport and Matt Richtel

articles.headline: Insider Trading Case Links Golfer, Banker and Gambler
articles.snippet: Phil Mickelson and an ex-investment banker owed money to a Vegas kingmaker. Prosecutors say those debts were at the center of a insider trading scheme.
articles.abstract: Phil Mickelson and an ex-investment banker owed money to a Vegas kingmaker. Prosecutors say those debts were at the center of a insider trading scheme.
articles.lead_paragraph: Phil Mickelson has five major golf championships and countless endorsement deals. Thomas C. Davis, a former investment banker, has a Harvard pedigree and a country club lifestyle.
articles.byline: By Matthew Goldstein, Ben Protess and Alexandra Stevenson

articles.headline: Warren Buffett Stake Suggests Apple Is All Grown Up
articles.snippet: When a value investor buys in, it’s a sign that a high-flying growth company has joined the ranks of venerable tech companies like IBM and Intel.
articles.abstract: When a value investor buys in, it’s a sign that a high-flying growth company has joined the ranks of venerable tech companies like IBM and Intel.
articles.lead_paragraph: With this week’s imprimatur from the legendary investor Warren Buffett, it should now be official: Apple, the world’s largest company by market capitalization and a symbol of American technological innovation, is a “value” stock.

articles.headline: A Child Care Gap in the Résumé: Whether to Explain or Not
articles.snippet: Though many women follow “don’t ask, don’t tell” when job-seeking after a child care gap, a study says it may be better to explain why they stayed home.
articles.abstract: Though many women follow “don’t ask, don’t tell” when job-seeking after a child care gap, a study says it may be better to explain why they stayed home.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Brooke Bleyl started job hunting after taking 10 years off to care for her children, her interviews did not go well.
